about_us.description: is a Christian mission that aims to stir up Christians to action, connect them and connect churches and Christian organizations for the purpose of increasing efficiency of witnessing the Gospel and spreading God‚Äôs Kingdom. Through the ariseforchrist.com website and with the help of the interconnected social platforms, christians will be able to communicate with each other much more easily, they can come together to encourage and act together in the name of Christ. We unify our efforts and knowledge in order to proclamation the Gospel and for the enlargement of the Kingdom of God, starting from Romania.
about_us.description_p1_1: Arise for Christ is a Christian mission that aims to mobilize Christians to action, connect them, and organize Christian organizations to be more effective in proclaiming the Gospel and extending the Kingdom of God. Through the portal ariseforchrist.com and using social media networking, Christians will be able to communicate more easily, unite, and encourage each other to act together for Christ.
about_us.description_p1_6: We join our efforts and knowledge to witness the Gospel and extend the Kingdom of God worldwide, starting from Romania. Fulfilling God's desire (1 Timothy 2:4) is the mission of our association, motivated by God's love for us, and in turn, we do it for people (1 John 3:16).
about_us.description_p3_1: We aspire to see a growing movement of Christians who act for Christ and implement the principles of the Kingdom of God. We desire churches and believers to be dedicated to winning souls for God, restoring those who have fallen, and helping those with different problems for their spiritual growth. We do not intend to replace the mission of the Lord's Church but rather emphasize, motivate, and serve as a bridge for evangelizing people and serving believers.
about_us.description_p4_1: Our mission is built on values, which determine our actions and way of working.
about_us.description_p5_2: All things are from Him, through Him, and for Him. We love God by living for Him, and what we do is a response to His love. We act in a Christ-centered way, and our focus is on Christ.
about_us.description_p6_2: Love for the Lord Jesus Christ leads us to love people. Our goal is to see Him as the Lord and Savior of many people. His love has ignited a passion for people in us. The conviction that Jesus Christ is the only way of salvation drives us to use these methods to reach people's hearts. The importance of the family is a priority; therefore, our service focuses on families.
about_us.description_p7_2: Faith is demonstrated through actions! We want to be influential, motivating, and contagious for believers in favor of the unchurched, those who have fallen away from faith, and those with various problems.
about_us.description_p8_2: Like the Apostle Paul, our heart's desire and prayer to God is for Romanians to be saved (Romans 10:1, 11:13-14). We believe in a global vision that goes beyond the context of local and denominational church involvement and involves unity, diversity, and dedication to Christ's cause in the world. We support long-term or short-term missionary work in specific areas of the world.
about_us.principals_p1_1: Our mission can be summarized in two words: salvation and action. Salvation for those who do not know Christ and mobilization of believers through concrete actions.
about_us.principals_p2_2: God's love is the source of our passion, and we desire people to be overwhelmed by it. We pray and intercede for people passionately.
about_us.principals_p3_2: Without dedication in all areas of our work, there is no success. We have dedicated collaborators who are a source of inspiration for many.
about_us.principals_p4_2: We want to be real, honest, humble, and separated from any religious forms, anchored in the truth of the Scriptures, which we communicate in love. Being authentic Christians in our context means that our actions are the best evidence of our authenticity.
about_us.principals_p5_2: We constantly seek zonal and local collaborations with missions, missionaries, evangelists, churches, and collaborators with whom we serve together for the Kingdom. We form partnerships and associate with those who share the same biblical values as us. We are aware that the work needs to be carried out in collaboration with believers at all levels of function.
about_us.principals_p6_2: We believe that the Bible, both the Old and New Testaments, is verbally inspired by God, inerrant in the original, unique, and the final authority in matters of faith, morality, and Christian practice.
about_us.principals_p6_3: We believe in one God, the Infinite and Perfect Spirit, existing from eternity in three persons: the Father, the Son, and the Holy Spirit, the Creator of the entire universe.
about_us.principals_p6_4: We believe that Jesus Christ was conceived by the Holy Spirit and born of the Virgin Mary, in His sinless life, being at the same time true God and true man.
about_us.principals_p6_5: We believe that the Lord Jesus Christ died for our sins, according to the Scriptures, as a representative and substitutionary sacrifice, and that all who believe and trust in Him are justified by His shed blood.
about_us.principals_p6_6: We believe in the bodily resurrection of our crucified Lord and in His Ascension to heaven, where He currently intercedes for us as Advocate and High Priest.
about_us.principals_p6_7: We believe that man was created by God in His image and was good and righteous; however, he sinned through his own choice by disobedience, coming out from under God's authority, and as a result, he suffered not only physical death but also spiritual death, i.e., separation from God; that all human beings are born with a sinful nature, and when they reach the age of moral responsibility, they become sinners in thought, speech, and deed.
about_us.principals_p6_8: We believe that all who receive the Lord Jesus Christ by faith as Lord and Savior are born again by the Holy Spirit and, as a result, become children of God.
about_us.principals_p6_9: We believe in the salvation from sin (the salvation of man) through God's grace, through man's repentance, and through water baptism as a result of the change worked by the Spirit through the Word of God.
about_us.principals_p6_10: We believe in the Baptism of the Holy Spirit, in the operation of spiritual gifts for the service of the Lord's Church and the unchurched world.
about_us.principals_p6_11: We believe in that "blessed hope": the imminent return of our Lord and Savior Jesus Christ and the rapture of the Church.
about_us.principals_p6_12: We believe in the bodily resurrection of the just and the unjust, for the eternal happiness of the saved and for the eternal punishment of the lost through God's judgment.
about_us.statement5: Spreads the values of the Kingdom.

actone.heading_activities: You'll have the opportunity to serve in a number of different areas:
actone.heading_activities_item2: Visiting church members in their homes
actone.heading_activities_item7: Visiting and feeding the poor in surrounding areas
actone.heading_activities_p1: All these activities will build your faith and teach you the value of servanthood.
actone.heading_be_part: Be part of what God is doing in Asia!
actone.heading_be_part_p1: in partnership with Credo TV is producing the first ever christian reality TV show on the mission field!
actone.heading_be_part_p2: We are looking for 12 passionate Romanian christians to join us for one month in the Philippines! From the pulpits to the slums, from schools to prisons and door to door evangelism, you will have the opportunity to be part of the revival that has started in the Philippines. And the most exciting part is that you get to share this experience with the Christian community around the world through the televised reality show!

actone.heading_costs_p2: . This will include all video & sound equipment, production/video production, team salaries, travel expenses, events logistics, supplies, admin & all other associated activities.
actone.heading_costs_p3: Each individual missionary will be required to raise
actone.heading_costs_p4: . This amount will help cover all your food, lodging, ministry expenses and other associated costs. You will be requested to raise funds for specific projects.
actone.heading_costs_p5: Your flight is not included in the trip costs. We will welcome you at the airport in Manila and transportation will be provided to the ministry location.

actone.heading_trip_like: What the mission trip will be like
actone.heading_trip_like_p1: Our destination is Orion, located in the southern part of Bataan Peninsula. For one month, you will have the opportunity to present to the Romanian community what it‚Äôs like to be a missionary in Asia - the highs and the lows, the joys and the sorrows.
actone.heading_trip_like_p2: We will split into groups of four missionaries, accompanied by videographers who will capture all the important moments of the day - from the moment you go out to serve, to the end of the day debrief.
actone.heading_why_p1: With a population of more than 106 million people across its 7,500 islands, the Philippines proudly boasts to be the only Christian nation in Asia. Heavily influenced by the West, they are the fifth-largest English-speaking country, and Roman Catholicism is the predominant religion with about 80% of Filipinos identifying as such. Only 13% identify as evangelical Christians. There is great need for evangelism, church strengthening, leadership development, and cross-cultural missions training in the Philippines.
actone.heading_why_p2: Arise for Christ has been partnering with local churches in the Bataan region for multiple years, being involved in church planting and other missionary work.

vision.description: Arise for Christ is based on a personal evangelism project that requires the involvement of Christians for salvation of their family and friends.
vision.presentation_p1_1: Our name is inspired from Isaiah 60:1: ‚ÄûArise, shine! For your light has come! And the glory of the Lord is risen upon you. Romans 11:36: ‚ÄûFor of Him and through Him and to Him are all things, to whom be glory forever. Amen.
vision.presentation_p2: Arise for Christ is a christian mission that operates for the Kingdom of God. Our goal is to mobilize christians for personal evangelization and the restoration of those who have fallen away from faith.
vision.presentation_p3_3: restoring those who have fallen away from faith,
vision.projects_p1_3: We aim to connect with the unchurched individuals within the families of believers. Every believer has someone unchurched in their family or vicinity, and we are all responsible for connecting them with the Gospel! The person for whom the request is made enters the process of evangelization, with the ultimate goal of their salvation.
vision.projects_p2_2: They are sought for the purpose of their spiritual recovery and rehabilitation. We apply the same plan as in personal evangelization, but the approaches vary from case to case.
vision.projects_p3_2: Is provided to offer spiritual help to those going through various life issues. They are supported emotionally and spiritually to find resolutions for the problems and situations they are facing, and in most cases, we support them in prayer.
vision.projects_p3_6: An important factor in all these. Each person we work with will be supported through prayer.
vision.projects_p4_2: Aim to spread the Word of God through various forms in the online environment. We create podcasts on relevant topics and other video materials with biblical teachings, testimonies, and examples of Christian life.
vision.projects_p5: In 2023, the Arise for Christ team visited the Philippines. As a result of our short-term missionary actions, we produced a series of 15 episodes, broadcasted on Credo TV and published on YouTube.
vision.step1_description: Arise for Christ mission will contact the local pastor in order to plan the personal evangelism process presentation in the local church.
vision.step2_description: Personal evangelism process will be presented in local church in order to encourage the involvement of its members in this process.
vision.step3_description: The local church members can fill evangelism requests for their unsaved loved ones through ariseforchrist.com platform or by filling an evangelism card available in the local church.
vision.step4_description: Prayer support is essential for the personal evangelism process to succeed.a) Prayer for the unbelievers who are to be evangelized; b) Prayer for forming new personal evangelism local groups; c) Prayer for the thriving of personal evangelism ministry developed by Arise for Christ in collaboration with the local churches.
vision.step5_description: The local church collaborators or personal evangelism groups will contact the unbelievers from their locality or neighborhood. Arise for Christ will contact the unbelievers from other regions through the local collaborators.
vision.step6_description: The unbeliever will be visited with the purpose of building a relationship and sharing the Gospel.
vision.step7_description: After building a relationship with the unbeliever, he is invited to attend a local church meeting. The evangelism process continues, guiding his steps towards his transformation and discipleship.
vision.step8_description: Arise for Christ will work closely with those responsible for the local church personal evangelism process and with the person who made the evangelism request, regularly reporting the progress.
vision.title: Personal evangelism process steps applied to the local church.

day_1.title: Approaching People
day_1.verset: Encourage and build one another up, just as you are doing.
day_1.paragraf_1: Throughout the Scriptures, the theme of building up others is repeated. Putting others first, being selfless, honoring whom it is due, and not withholding good from those who need it when it is in your power to act‚Äîthese are ways to build others up so they feel encouraged. Building up means lifting someone, and this happens through a long process.
day_1.paragraf_2: You must see the value in someone to help them grow. Encouraging someone creates an unseen benefit for you.
day_1.paragraf_3: Contribute to someone‚Äôs growth before asking them to do something. A hallmark of biblical communication is creating connections and relationships.

step_1.title: ENCOURAGE someone
step_1.description: Every person carries a unique gift placed there by God. Recognizing what God has placed in them and speaking about this gift brings it to light.

step_2.title: APPRECIATE a decision
step_2.description: Appreciating someone‚Äôs decision communicates the trust you have in them.

step_3.title: ADMIRE an achievement
step_3.description: Successes are sacred to the person who achieved them. Honoring a milestone signals that you respect the person and their accomplishment.

reflection_questions: How do you regularly seek to build up those around you?
In whom do you see greatness that others overlook?
Who can you encourage, appreciate, or admire today?
day_1.conclusion: Until you approach people within a relationship, they will not follow you in professional aspects.

day_2.title: An Effective Leader
day_2.verset: Therefore, take up the full armor of God, so that you may be able to resist in the evil day, and having done everything, to stand firm.
day_2.paragraf_1: Every profession has a set of tools necessary for its successful practice. Paul uses the analogy of military armor to present the weapons that a soldier of Christ can use daily.
day_2.paragraf_2: Before entering spiritual service, Jesus used the tools of a carpenter. Later, He used tools like communication, compassion, mentoring, and more.

step_1.title: Focus
step_1.description: Focus is the ability to work on one thing while eliminating all other distractions.

step_2.title: Prioritize
step_2.description: Dedicate most time to activities and events that produce the greatest return during a day.

step_3.title: Be opportunity-oriented
step_3.description: Someone, somewhere, has a problem. Successful people focus on discovering and solving problems.

reflection_questions: Do you know someone who is very skilled at leveraging a set of skills?
Do you have a mentor you could ask to share their daily strategy for achieving success?
What tools do you use that are not on the list above and make you successful?
day_2.conclusion: God created mental connections in your brain to help you run the race of your life well.

day_3.title: The Puzzle Master
day_3.verset: While Peter was wondering about the meaning of the vision, the men sent by Cornelius found out where Simon's house was and stopped at the gate.
day_3.paragraf_1: God often hides something from you so that you can find someone you want to connect with.
day_3.paragraf_2: God is the one who thought of partnerships. Many times, He will give you only half of what you need so that you are motivated to find the other half.

step_1.title: Discover by talking
step_1.description: Ask God for help, then wait to see whom He brings to your mind.

step_2.title: Share the need
step_2.description: Start sharing the need with those you contact and see who responds.

step_3.title: Read the Scripture
step_3.description: Read the Scripture with an open heart and ask, 'Lord, what should I do about this?'

reflection_questions: Who do you feel prompted to discuss your problem with today?
Are you dealing with an issue where someone close to you might have experience?
Is it possible that, in the past week, someone sought you to be a listening ear?
day_3.conclusion: God‚Äôs plan for partnership means giving one piece of the puzzle to you and another to someone else, motivating you to seek the missing piece.

day_4.title: Setting Spiritual Goals
day_4.verset: The Lord answered me and said: 'Write the vision and make it plain on tablets, that he may run who reads it.'
day_4.paragraf_1: Have you asked God for a vision for your life? Not all visions come from God, but when He gives you one, He writes it on the tablet of your heart.
day_4.paragraf_2: Let the vision develop until it takes shape in your life. If you reflect on it and keep it alive, it will grow in your heart.

step_1.title: Spiritual
step_1.description: Dedicating time every day to learn about God and speak with Him is the most important goal.

step_2.title: Social and relational
step_2.description: Who do you need to bring into your circle, and who do you need to distance yourself from?

step_3.title: Emotional
step_3.description: Define how you want to feel and the mindset of success you need to adopt to get there.

reflection_questions: Are there areas in your life that are out of balance?
How can you help someone else reach their goals?
What purpose or vision has God given you for this season of your life?
day_4.conclusion: Let the vision develop until it takes shape in your life.

day_5.title: Rise Up
day_5.verset: For God has not given us a spirit of fear, but of power, love, and a sound mind.
day_5.paragraf_1: There is an acronym for F.E.A.R. that has helped me choose faith over fear‚Äîactually, two.
day_5.paragraf_2: When you face fear, remember: faith means stepping forward motivated by His presence.

step_1.title: Speak God's words
step_1.description: Remember verses that encourage you, such as Philippians 4:13 or 2 Timothy 1:7.

step_2.title: Face fear
step_2.description: Adopt strategies to overcome fear and step out of your comfort zone.

step_3.title: Plan small steps
step_3.description: Build progress toward your goal by focusing on small, achievable steps.

reflection_questions: When was the last time fear paralyzed you?
Do you have a strategy for overcoming fear?
In what way has God challenged you to step out of your comfort zone?
day_5.conclusion: You are made to be a conqueror through His Word, which gives you the power to overcome.

day_6.title: The Four Voices
day_6.verset: After they have left the right path, they have gone astray and followed the way of Balaam...
day_6.paragraf_1: Have you ever been convinced to do something you knew you shouldn‚Äôt? Balaam was a man through whom God spoke to Israel... until he no longer did.
day_6.paragraf_2: There are four voices you must learn to distinguish clearly: Your voice, God‚Äôs voice, the voice of others, and the enemy‚Äôs voice.

step_1.title: Your voice
step_1.description: Your mind automatically generates thoughts and impressions. You must learn to control them or become their slave.

step_2.title: God's voice
step_2.description: God‚Äôs voice resonates through the words of the Bible, guiding us on the right path.

step_3.title: The voice of others
step_3.description: You must discern between various external influences and ensure their messages align with Scripture.

reflection_questions: Can you remember a moment when your conscience steered you away from a wrong decision?
Which of the four voices is currently the strongest for you?
Have you ever convinced yourself to do something you knew was not right?
day_6.conclusion: If you ignore God‚Äôs voice, another voice will take its place.

day_7.title: Knowing When to Stop
day_7.verset: And David received from her hand what she had brought him and said to her, 'Go up in peace to your house...'
day_7.paragraf_1: When you have come to a conclusion, stop the discussion. Abigail knew when to withdraw after achieving her purpose.
day_7.paragraf_2: Agitation, over-talking, or becoming too personal can sabotage an important request.

step_1.title: Avoid agitation
step_1.description: Agitation leads to over-talking, which may annoy the other person.

step_2.title: Stay calm
step_2.description: After making a request, be silent and allow the other person to respond.

step_3.title: Remain professional
step_3.description: Do not become overly familiar in a professional context after receiving a positive response.

reflection_questions: Do you remember how you behaved during an important request in the past?
What mental trigger can you use to know when to end a conversation?
Do you know someone who knows how to get what they want and withdraw at the right time?
day_7.conclusion: You sabotage yourself if you make a request and keep talking without giving the other person time to respond.

day_8.title: God‚Äôs GPS
day_8.verset: Delight yourself in the Lord, and He will give you the desires of your heart.
day_8.paragraf_1: God guides us to our destination through pleasure and peace when we are on the right path and unrest when we stray.
day_8.paragraf_2: The signals must be tested against Scripture. God‚Äôs GPS is guided by His Word.

step_1.title: What keeps me up at night?
step_1.description: Worry can be a sign of something God wants you to resolve.

step_2.title: What brings me fulfillment?
step_2.description: Activities that bring you joy are evidence you are running in the right lane.

step_3.title: What causes me pain?
step_3.description: Pain may indicate a place you should not be.

reflection_questions: Do you know someone who has learned to discern God‚Äôs direction?
Where is God‚Äôs GPS guiding you?
What signals have you discovered God uses to communicate with you?
day_8.conclusion: God communicates with you before trying to take you somewhere. What is He telling you?

day_9.title: Providential Meetings
day_9.verset: Do not forget to show hospitality to strangers, for by so doing some people have shown hospitality to angels without knowing it.
day_9.paragraf_1: God works in us to fulfill His plans. Sometimes, help comes through providential meetings.
day_9.paragraf_2: Are you attentive to strangers who cross your path? God uses these encounters to guide us.

step_1.title: Recognize help
step_1.description: Pay attention to moments when God works through people to assist you.

step_2.title: Have faith
step_2.description: Take steps in faith before seeing the results.

step_3.title: Serve intentionally
step_3.description: Serve those around you, recognizing providential moments.

reflection_questions: When was the last time you thanked God for the help you received?
Did the help come unexpectedly or through prayer?
What would you try to do if you knew God supported you at every step?
day_9.conclusion: God walks dressed in ordinary clothes. Do you recognize His providential fingerprints?

day_10.title: The Level of Expectations
day_10.verset: If anyone forces you to go one mile, go with them two miles.
day_10.paragraf_1: Jesus used the example of going the extra mile to teach us not to settle for less.
day_10.paragraf_2: How do we exceed others‚Äô expectations? This builds a better opinion of us.

step_1.title: Define the standards
step_1.description: Understand what is expected of you and aim to surpass those expectations.

step_2.title: Act with excellence
step_2.description: Focus on quality and consistency in everything you do.

step_3.title: Add value
step_3.description: Offer more than what is required, whether through effort, kindness, or creativity.

reflection_questions: What areas of your life are you currently meeting expectations rather than exceeding them?
How can you go the extra mile in your relationships or work?
Who has exceeded your expectations recently, and how did it impact you?
day_10.conclusion: Exceeding expectations requires intentionality and effort, but it creates lasting impressions and builds trust.
